column4: can someone please tell me if the easy-access audio ports at the front of my PC are worse quality than the ones at the back?
they are because of interference and cable length, but its doubtful you can hear the difference
so it still uses HD audio?
technically yes, but from an analog viewpoint your soundquality decreases
ok, thanks :) and its not physically that far away, because my 'front' sound ports are not in 'front' in that sense. They are on top (closer to the mobo).
uhm, well it doesnt really concern Ubuntu what you asked, tho im still happy to help :)
starting at 75Â° its getting too hot
usually not, if you turn up the voltages too high, it will break
so I went out to buy a 2.4GHz, and it wouldn't even overclock. i got a bad batch or something ^^
